Package com.redis.foundation.ds

Class DGCriteria

java.lang.Object
com.redis.foundation.ds.DGCriteria
public class DGCriteria extends Object
A DGCriteria can be used to express a search criteria for a graph data source. In its simplest form, it can capture type, labels item names (properties), logical operators (equal, less-than, greater-than), item values and hops. In addition, it also supports grouping these expressions with boolean operators such as AND and OR.
Since:
1.0
Author:
Al Cole

    • DGCriteria

      public DGCriteria(String aName, DataDoc aSrcNode, DataDoc aDstNode, DataDoc anEdgeDoc)
      Convenience constructor which creates a criteria that will isolate the relationship between the source and destination nodes.
      Parameters:
      aName - Name of criteria.
      aSrcNode - Source node data document instance.
      aDstNode - Destination node data document instance.
      anEdgeDoc - Edge node data document instance.

    • addFeature

      public void addFeature(String aName, String aValue)
      Add a unique feature to this criteria. A feature enhances the core capability of the criteria. Standard features are listed below.
      • Data.FEATURE_OPERATION_NAME
      Parameters:
      aName - Name of the feature.
      aValue - Value to associate with the feature.

      Returns:

    • addProperty

      public void addProperty(String aName, Object anObject)
      Add an application defined property to the criteria. Notes:
      • The goal of the DGCriteria is to strike a balance between providing enough properties to adequately model application related data without overloading it.
      • This method offers a mechanism to capture additional (application specific) properties that may be needed.
      • Properties added with this method are transient and will not be persisted when saved.
      Parameters:
      aName - Property name (duplicates are not supported).
      anObject - Instance of an object.

    • getProperty

      public Object getProperty(String aName)
      Returns the object associated with the property name or null if the name could not be matched.
      Parameters:
      aName - Name of the property.
      Returns:
      Instance of an object.

    • clearProperties

      public void clearProperties()
      Removes all application defined properties assigned to this bag.

    • getProperties

      public HashMap<String,Object> getProperties()
      Returns the property map instance managed by the criteria or null if empty.
      Returns:
      Hash map instance.
